intro: Luzula campestroides, commonly known as the field woodrush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly referred to as the grass family. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like clusters of flowers. Luzula campestroides is characterized by its ability to thrive in wet conditions and its ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
